instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
threads.message:
Guys,

I just try to figure out what happen this board.
Won't charge and running really REALLY slow.

Any advice? Where i can start  troubleshooting

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
threads.message: Run EFI ASD to check for sensor errors. Is battery recognized in OSX and is the condition reported as "normal"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] I get this error on [I]SMC IO error[/I].

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
threads.message: No, EFI ASD will give you an exact sensor. Do again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't charge and running Slow
threads.message: TW0p airport sensor is mounted on IO board. So either bad cable or corrosion on connectors.
